channel.title: CVE Feed for InHand Networks -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for InHand Networks -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-38486|2024-09-16T16:32:46.172Z -- inhand%20networks -- ir615%20router
item.description: InHand Networks IR615 Router's Versions 2.3.0.r4724 and 2.3.0.r4870 cloud portal allows for self-registration of the affected product without any requirements to create an account, which may allow an attacker to have full control over the product and execute code within the internal network to which the product is connected.

item.title: CVE-2021-38468|2024-09-16T16:49:18.085Z -- inhand%20networks -- ir615%20router
item.description: InHand Networks IR615 Router's Versions 2.3.0.r4724 and 2.3.0.r4870 are vulnerable to stored cross-scripting, which may allow an attacker to hijack sessions of users connected to the system.

item.title: CVE-2022-26042|2024-09-16T16:53:34.542Z -- inhand%20networks -- inrouter302
item.description: An OS command injection vulnerability exists in the daretools binary functionality of InHand Networks InRouter302 V3.5.4. A specially-crafted network request can lead to arbitrary command execution. An attacker can send a sequence of requests to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2021-38476|2024-09-16T16:17:43.791Z -- inhand%20networks -- ir615%20router
item.description: InHand Networks IR615 Router's Versions 2.3.0.r4724 and 2.3.0.r4870 authentication process response indicates and validates the existence of a username. This may allow an attacker to enumerate different user accounts.

item.title: CVE-2021-38462|2024-09-16T16:44:09.207Z -- inhand%20networks -- ir615%20router
item.description: InHand Networks IR615 Router's Versions 2.3.0.r4724 and 2.3.0.r4870 does not enforce an efficient password policy. This may allow an attacker with obtained user credentials to enumerate passwords and impersonate other application users and perform operations on their behalf.

item.title: CVE-2022-25172|2024-09-16T16:28:57.726Z -- inhand%20networks -- inrouter302
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in the web interface session cookie functionality of InHand Networks InRouter302 V3.5.4. The session cookie misses the HttpOnly flag, making it accessible via JavaScript and thus allowing an attacker, able to perform an XSS attack, to steal the session cookie.
